question.text: Identify I, II and II and select the correct option

options.text:
I II III
Each actin filament is made of two troponin helically wound Two filaments of F-actin run close to A-actin Tropomyosin is distributed at regular intervals

I II III
Each actin filament is made of two F-actins helically wound Two filaments of tropomyosin run close to F-actin Troponin is distributed at regular intervals

I II III
Each actin filament is made of two tropomyosins helically wound Two filaments of troponin run close to A-actin F-actin is distributed at regular intervals

I II III
Each actin filament is made of two troponin helically wound Two filaments of tropomyosin run close to F-actin F-actin is distributed at regular intervals

solution.text: Each actin (thin) filament is made of two 'F' (filamentous) actins helically wound to each other. Each 'F' actin is a polymer of monomeric 'G' (globular) actins. Two filaments of another protein, tropomyosin also run close to the 'F' actins throughout its length. A complex protein troponin is distributed at regular intervals on the tropomyosin.
